questions.question: The barometric pressure at the airfield datum point is known as:
The instrument that gives a continuous printed reading and record of the atmospheric pressure is:
The pressure of the atmosphere:
options: a. decreases at an increasing rate as height increases
b. decreases at a constant rate as height increases
c. decreases at a decreasing rate as height increases
d. decreases at a constant rate up to the tropopause and then remains constant

questions.question: When considering the actual tropopause which statement is correct?
options: a. It is low over the poles and high over the Equator
b. It is high over the poles and low over the Equator
c. It is the same height of 36 090 ft all over the world
d. It is at a constant altitude of 26000'

questions.question: Atmospheric pressure may be defined as:
options: a. the weight of the atmosphere exerted on any surface with which it is in contact
b. the weight of the atmosphere at standard sea level
c. the force per unit area exerted by the atmosphere on any surface with which it is in contact
d. a pressure exerted by the atmosphere of 1013.2 hPa

questions.question: The QFF is the atmospheric pressure:
options: a. at the place where the reading is taken
b. corrected for temperature difference from standard and adjusted to MSL assuming standard atmospheric conditions exist
c. at a place where the reading is taken corrected to MSL taking into account the prevailing temperature conditions
d. as measured by a barometer at the aerodrome reference point

questions.question: The pressure of 1013 hPa is known as:
The aircraft altimeter will read zero at aerodrome level with which pressure setting set on the altimeter subscale:
The aerodrome QFE is:
options: a. the reading on the altimeter on an aerodrome when the aerodrome barometric pressure is set on the subscale
b. the reading on the altimeter on touchdown at an aerodrome when 1013 is set on the subscale
c. the reading on the altimeter on an aerodrome when the sea level barometric pressure is set on the subscale

questions.question: When an altimeter subscale is set to the aerodrome QFE, the altimeter reads:
options: a. the elevation of the aerodrome at the aerodrome reference point
b. zero at the aerodrome reference point
c. the pressure altitude at the aerodrome reference point
d. the appropriate altitude of the aircraft

questions.question: The aerodrome QNH is the aerodrome barometric pressure:
options: a. corrected to mean sea level assuming standard atmospheric conditions exist
b. corrected to mean sea level, assuming isothermal conditions exist
c. corrected for temperature and adjusted to MSL assuming standard atmosphere conditions exist
d. corrected to MSL using ambient temperature

questions.question: A line drawn on a chart joining places having the same barometric pressure at the same level and at the same time is:
An isobar on a meteorological chart joins all places having the same:
Pressure will ______ with increase of height and will be about ______ at 10 000 ft and ______ at 30000 ft.
An airfield in England is 100 m above sea level, QFF is 1030 hPa, temperature at the surface is $-15^{\circ}C.$ What is the value of QNH?
